title: Scott Taggart
text:
Scott Taggart (born 27 December 1991) is a Scottish <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who plays for <a href="Alloa%20Athletic%20F.C.">Alloa Athletic</a>. Taggart can play as either a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> or a <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>.
Taggart has previously played for <a href="Hibernian%20F.C.">Hibernian</a>, <a href="Greenock%20Morton%20F.C.">Greenock Morton</a> and <a href="Dumbarton%20F.C.">Dumbarton</a>, as well as <a href="Ayr%20United%20F.C.">Ayr United</a> and <a href="Stranraer%20F.C.">Stranraer</a> on loan.
Career.
Taggart was signed by <a href="Hibernian%20F.C.">Hibernian</a> after impressing in a match against their youth team. He was part of the Hibs youth team that won a league and <a href="Scottish%20Youth%20Cup">cup</a> double in <a href="2008%E2%80%9309%20in%20Scottish%20football">2008–09</a>. Taggart went out on loan to <a href="Ayr%20United%20F.C.">Ayr United</a> during the 2010–11 season. He made six league appearances for the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League%20Second%20Division">Scottish Second Division</a> side. He made his first team debut for Hibs on 7 May 2011, as a substitute against <a href="Hamilton%20Academical%20F.C.">Hamilton</a>.
In September 2011, Taggart went on a three-month loan to <a href="Scottish%20Third%20Division">Scottish Third Division</a> side <a href="Stranraer%20F.C.">Stranraer</a>. He made his debut on 26 September, in their 1–0 victory against <a href="Elgin%20City%20F.C.">Elgin City</a>. He scored his first senior goal on 10 December 2011, in a 6–0 win for Stranraer against <a href="East%20Stirlingshire%20F.C.">East Stirlingshire</a>. His loan spell ended on 23 December and he returned to Hibs, but he was again loaned to Stranraer in January 2012. Taggart scored for Stranraer in the first appearance of his second spell with them, in a 5–2 win against Elgin City on 28 January. He returned to Hibs at the end of this second loan, but was released at the end of his contract in May 2012.
Taggart signed for <a href="Greenock%20Morton%20F.C.">Greenock Morton</a> in July 2012. He played regularly as Morton performed well during the <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20Scottish%20First%20Division">2012–13 Scottish First Division</a>. Taggart left Morton after rejecting a new deal in June 2014.
On 21 June 2014, Taggart signed for <a href="Dumbarton%20F.C.">Dumbarton</a>. He made his league debut in a 4–1 defeat to <a href="Rangers%20F.C.">Rangers</a> at <a href="Ibrox%20Stadium">Ibrox</a> and scored his first goal for the club in a 3–3 draw with <a href="Falkirk%20F.C.">Falkirk</a> in January 2015.
After two seasons with the side Taggart left Dumbarton in May 2016, signing for <a href="Scottish%20League%20One">Scottish League One</a> side <a href="Alloa%20Athletic%20F.C.">Alloa Athletic</a> shortly after.
Honours.
Club.
Morton
